Class ComputedAttributeUtils

  • java.lang.Object

extends Object
    Computed attribute functions for string manipulation.

      • getUserAccountControlAttribute

        public static boolean getUserAccountControlAttribute​(int uac,
                                                     String attributeName)
        Returns whether a specific attribute is set in the userAccountControl value provided.
        Parameters:
        uac - the userAccountControl value
        attributeName - the name of the attribute to check
        Returns:
        true if the specified attribute is set, false otherwise
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the attribute name is invalid

      • getMsDsUserAccountControlComputedAttribute

                                                                 String attributeName)
        Returns whether a specific attribute is set in the ms-DS-user-Account-Control-Computed value provided.
        Parameters:
        uac - the ms-DS-user-Account-Control-Computed value
        attributeName - the name of the Ms-Ds-User-Account-Control-Computed-Attribute to check
        Returns:
        true if the specified attribute is set, false otherwise
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the attribute name is invalid

      • inferPrivilegedAccountFromUac

        public static boolean inferPrivilegedAccountFromUac​(int uac)
        Checks if the account has any flags that might indicate elevated privileges.
        Parameters:
        uac - the userAccountControl value
        Returns:
        true if any flags indicating elevated privileges are set, false otherwise

      • getUserAccountControlAttributes

        public static boolean getUserAccountControlAttributes​(int uac,
                                                      boolean performAndOperation,
                                                      String... attributeNames)
        Checks if the specified attributes are set in the userAccountControl value based on the operation to perform.
        Parameters:
        uac - the userAccountControl value
        performAndOperation - if true, all specified attributes must be set; if false, at least one must be set
        attributeNames - the names of the attributes to check
        Returns:
        true if the specified condition is met, false otherwise
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if any attribute name is invalid

      • convertBase64ObjectGuidToUuid

        public static String convertBase64ObjectGuidToUuid​(String base64ObjectGuid)
        Converts a Base64-encoded objectGUID from AD into a UUID string representation.
        Parameters:
        base64ObjectGuid - the Base64-encoded objectGUID
        Returns:
        the UUID string representation of the objectGUID
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the input is null, empty, or not 16 bytes long

      • convertBase64GuidToHex

        public static String convertBase64GuidToHex​(String base64Guid)
        Converts a Base64-encoded GUID into a hexadecimal string representation.
        Parameters:
        base64Guid - the Base64-encoded GUID
        Returns:
        the hexadecimal string representation of the GUID
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the input is null, empty, or not 16 bytes long

      • normalizeDn

        public static String normalizeDn​(String dnStr)
        Retrieves a normalized string representation of the provided string representation of the dn.
        Parameters:
        dnStr - the string representation of the dn. If the input DN is null, the method returns null.
        Returns:
        the normalized string representation of the dn
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the dn is invalid

      • normalizeDns

        public static List<String> normalizeDns​(List<String> dnStrList)
        Transforms a list of distinguished name (DN) strings into a list of normalized DN strings. This method takes a list of DN strings in their original representation and converts each DN into its normalized form.
        Parameters:
        dnStrList - the list of DN strings to be normalized. If the input list is null, the method returns null.
        Returns:
        a list of normalized DN strings, or null if the input list is null.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if any of the DN strings in the list are invalid.

      • filterDescendentOf

        public static String filterDescendentOf​(String dnStr,
                                        String parentDnStr)
        Filters the specified DN string based on its relationship to the given parent DN string. Returns the DN string if it is a descendant of the parent DN string, or null if it is not.
        Parameters:
        dnStr - the DN string to check
        parentDnStr - the parent DN string
        Returns:
        the DN string if it is a descendant of the parent DN, or null otherwise
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the dn is invalid

      • filterDescendentsOf

        public static List<String> filterDescendentsOf​(List<String> dnStrList,
                                               String parentDnStr)
        Filters the provided list of dn strings based on their relationship to the given parent DN string. Returns a list of DN strings that are descendants of the parent DN string, or null if none are.
        Parameters:
        dnStrList - the list of DN strings to check
        parentDnStr - the parent DN string
        Returns:
        a list of DN strings that are descendants of the parent DN, or null if none are
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the dn is invalid

      • getParent

        public static String getParent​(String dnStr)
        The DN that is the parent for the provide String dn, or null if there is no parent.
        Parameters:
        dnStr - the DN string to check
        Returns:
        the parent DN string, or null if there is no parent
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the dn is invalid

      • getRdnValue

        public static String getRdnValue​(String dnStr)
        Retrieves the first attribute value for the leftmost RDN of the provided string representation of the dn.
        Parameters:
        dnStr - the string representation of the dn
        Returns:
        the first attribute value for the leftmost RDN, or null if none exists
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the dn is invalid
